class TriggerTimer< AbstractItemGrid >

Detailed Description

An abstract item grid may contain a variable number of items, which are displayed inside a vertically scrollable grid. If the item grid only has one column, it behaves like a listbox.

The rendering of the items is defined by an instance of the class AbstractItemRenderer, which may be changed by AbstractItemGrid::SetRenderer.

The method AbstractGrid::GetColumnCount must be overwritten to be able to instantiate the class.

See also:
AbstractItemRenderer

AbstractItemContainer *  item_cont = 0

Parameters:
parent Parent control where the abstract item grid is embedded.
item_cont Item container, which specifies the items which should be part of the abstract item grid. If no item container is specified, an item container is allocated automatically internally.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN AbstractItemGrid::AddItem (  Item *  item  ) 
 

Adds the item item after the already added items. For other item operations use AbstractItemGrid::GetItemContainer and invoke the corresponding methods of the AbstractItemGrid interface.

void AbstractItemGrid::CleanupImageCache (   )  [protected]
 

Cleans up the image cache to an empty state, which means that no image is in the cache anymore.

void AbstractItemGrid::DrawItemBorder (  DeviceContext *  dc,
const Rect &  cell_rect,
const Rect &  item_rect,
INT  item_index
)  const [protected, virtual]
 

Draws the item-border between the cell-rectangle and the item-rectangle for the item with the index item_index. Usually the cell-rectangle is equal to the item-rectangle, but this can be adjusted (see AbstractItemGrid::GetItemRect).

Reimplemented in ItemTree.

AbstractItemContainer * AbstractItemGrid::GetItemContainer (   )  const [virtual]

Reimplemented in ItemTree.

Rect AbstractItemGrid::GetItemRect (  INT  item_index  )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Returns the boundaries for the item with the index item_index. Per default the boundaries of the cell-rectangle are returned (see AbstractGrid::GetCellRect). If this method will be overwritten to return different boundaries, it must be assured the the item-rectangle is a subset of the cell-rectangle.

Reimplemented in ItemTree.

const AbstractItemRenderer* AbstractItemGrid::GetRenderer (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the renderer which is used for drawing the items.

Item * AbstractItemGrid::GetSelectedItem (   )  const
 

Returns the currently selected item. 0 is returned if the abstract item grid does not contain any item.

void AbstractItemGrid::RefreshImageCache (   )  [protected]
 

Refreshs the internal image cache which is used for buffering "expensive" images like JPEG or PNG. It is not necessary to invoke this method when the items have a proper dispatcher. But sometimes it might be more efficient to set the dispatcher of items temporary to 0, update the items, adjust the dispatcher and refresh the image cache in one step.

void AbstractItemGrid::SetHeaderItem (  INT  column,
Item *  item
) 
 

Sets a header specified by item to the given column. The header is displayed as first row of the grid and is always visible.

void AbstractItemGrid::SetItemContainer (  AbstractItemContainer *  item_cont  ) 
 

Sets the item container item_cont as root item container for displaying.

BOOLEAN AbstractItemGrid::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

Reimplemented from AbstractGrid.

Reimplemented in ItemGrid, ItemMenu, and ItemTree.

void AbstractItemGrid::SetRenderer (  const ItemRendererProperties *  properties = 0  ) 
 

Sets the renderer which is used for drawing the items with the specified properties. If this method is not invoked, the default-properties specified by GuiEngineConfig::GetDefaultItemRendererProperties are used.

Parameters:
properties Item-renderer-properties which are used by the renderer.

void AbstractItemGrid::SetSelectedIndex (  INT  idx  )  [virtual]
 

See also:
AbstractGrid::SetSelectedIndex

Reimplemented from AbstractGrid.

void AbstractItemGrid::SwitchItemContainer (  AbstractItemContainer *  item_cont  )  [protected]
 

Switch to the given item container for displaying, which is useful for derived classes like ItemMenu and ItemTree, as they temporary show a sub item container. It is important to restore the old item container before deleting the item grid by invoking AbstractItemGrid::SwitchItemContainer(old_item_cont).
